Overwatch is complicated. The hate behind it is valid, the hate for Robert, Satan's Vanguard is incredibly valid. 

BUT. It is still one of the most fun, fluid shooters on the market, and there's not a whole lot like it. The new PvE missions, while not what was promised, are very fun. The story is good, carried by the characters. 

Unfortunately, the missed potential is still there. Maybe microsoft will bring deliverance. /shrug

Let me say beforehand that I have 19 hours in game on Battle.

Too many unlocks require you to grind the battle pass, and to grind it you need to do a list of tasks (dailies, weeklies, etc.). The exp you get from matches are far too little, and you CAN NOT use Custom Game or VS Ai for the tasks mentioned earlier. Custom Games, I get, but why not VS Ai? I'm still playing the game as vanilla as possible. But no, I gotta play quick play, comp (I never unlocked it, and most likely never will), and arcade (As you can guess I am not good at FPS games).

Two major problems with this. The first is that you MUST use a wired connection, wireless will cause many disconnects (My WiFi works for every other game I have BUT Overwatch. Checking the Blizzard forums told me I need to use a wired connection). The second problem is that turning off in-game chat is practically mandatory for someone like me who is bad at games, even in arcade, which to me is THE CASUAL SIDE OF CASUAL. Turning off in-game chat doesn't change the fact that I'm letting down my team and ruining the game for them. Now if I could play with and against the AI it would be fine, as they take my incompetence with them to the grave. But as mentioned before, practically all unlocks are disabled should I try to have a single player experience.

Speaking of single player, why can't I do the PvE missions solo with bots? I don't want to drag the team down like I do in PvP. I heard about PvE was planned to be, and I'm disappointed that it turned out how it did, it could've been so much more. (It was in development for 5 years and they scrapped over half of it, or so I was told. Correct me if I'm wrong). To play PvE, you need to buy a $15 bundle, which has a free skin and 1,000 Overwatch Coins.

This leads into my next point about the battle pass, it costs $10 to buy the premium pass. Two big problems, first is that the premium track gives you new heroes at level 1, while the free track gives you new heroes at 45. This means that, BY TECHNICALITY, Overwatch 2 is pay-2-win should ANY of the new heroes be meta (This has happened before, and will happen again). The seconds problem is that the premium pass gives credits. Not coins, credits. Credits can only be used to buy cosmetics from Overwatch 1 (which you can no longer play). The battle pass would be infinitely better if you could earn enough COINS to buy the next one. But that won't happen, this is Blizzard we're talking about.

Despite the horrible, downright unacceptable monetization and (in my experience) toxic player base, the game is still pretty cool, which sucks, as it could be so much better, not just for multiplayer but also for single player.

TL;DR: Cool game ruined by horrible monetization and Blizzard being Blizzard. But if, despite it's flaws, the game looks interesting to you, go ahead and try it, it's free after all.

I've been one of the guys who has been playing since the beginning of OW1 and this game has been with my school days. And Blizzard brutally destroyed my memories with my school friends.

Sinceramente...

 Até dá pra se divertir por um tempo, mas depois de duas partidas vc já quer matar todas as pessoas da sua família pq existe a Mercy no jogo, pq o """"Balanceamento"""" dessa caceta é horroroso.

 E eu não vou nem começar a comentar sobre os preços das coisas. Skins que só mudam a cor do boneco e custam um rim. E 70 pila três missãozinha extremamente repetitivas, a única coisa legal são as cutsenes mas isso tu pode ver no YT de graça kskkk.

 Sem falar dos Updates que demoram MESES e não mudam porra nenhuma, parecendo que só tem 5 pessoas na equipe, sendo que existem jogos INDIES com literais 3 nego que fazem um trabalho melhor em deixar um jogo vivo e com qualidade.

 Jogo Overwatch por quase 6 anos, e vê-lo nesse estado deplorável realmente me dói. É realmente uma pena ver que uma obra com tanto potencial ser desperdiçada dessa forma.

 Parabéns Blizzard... Meteram o jogo na Steam pra ter mais publico, e acabaram recebendo um monte de nota negativa skkkk.

 Sendo bem sincero, eu preferiria que o Overwatch fechasse logo as portas, do que continuar assim...

Carinha triste :(
